title: Anyone else worried for other 'fun' champions?
body:
Both the Sion and GP reworks took a goofy character and made them deathly serious. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, of course, but it does set a worrying trend; namely, I'm worried for Vlad. I play Vlad mostly cause I think his puns are hilarious and I don't want them to go away. There are, of course, other champions who are also in danger of becoming more serious; Mundo, in particular, given his in-game and story personas are incredibly different, just like GP.

I want League to remain mostly silly. Taking yourself too seriously is really common in gaming these days, and I don't like it.

You're remembering wrong.

First, Dr. Mundo is not braindamaged. His oversized tongue causes massive speech impediments and he adopted his dialogue while in "Mundo" form. Kreuben Edmundo can leave Mundo form, but tends not to because he believes he represents Zaunite pride (If I'm remembering the JoJ interview correctly). He is as much as a genious as the hulking behemoth as he is as a frail, puny human.

Second, Kreuben Edmundo was born a cruel, twisted man. At age seven, no pets near his house survived. At age twelve, he KILLED HIS OWN PARENTS in an experiment and asked for emantipation. Even Zaun is mostly disgusted with his experiments, and the only reason he isn't lynched is because he is a huge scientific asset for both Zaun and Noxus. 

"He continues his experiments to this day, even using himself as an experimental subject, as evidenced by his disfigured appearance and his... unique manner of speaking. There are rumors that the High Command in Noxus has given him free reign to pursue his life's work in his spare time."

Straight from his lore. Also: "Beware the Madman of Zaun, for in his eyes you are already dead".


Dr. Mundo is NOT a joke character, he is NOT a goofy madman. He is a highly intelligent, calculating man that has as big of a kill list as Singed. Unless you find patricide, immoral experiments, sociopathy and a complete disregard for human life besides how entertaining and scientifically enlightening it is to see how a being reacts to having 50% of his bones crushed by huge, uncaring hands, the last thing DOCTOR Mundo is is loveable.

I did reference his monstrous behavior as a child when stating he didn't quite match Jekyll and Hyde because he was a monster before becoming one. I didn't keep up with joj often and so that he is can control the transformation is cool new info.

Obviously I didn't remember his lore entirely right because I was thinking of the "as evidenced" line and forgetting how valuable his experiments still are and that it probably means he is still brilliant. His in game representation does certainly contradict this (ie mundo say his own name a lot or else he forget it), but that is my point. I like the bumbling monster more than the vicious sociopath. I don't want to play a champ who would prefer to kill his teammates if they do poorly. That is a champ who would literally be expected to be toxic and experiment with the suffering of people whom he didn't find useful.

The direct conflict between bumbling monster who took his experiments on himself too far, and a cold calculating monster who finds experimental use in the suffering of his subjects, is so conflicting that you cannot really preserve both if you rework it and make a consistent lore theme. The problem is one group of people will like each side and it can be painful to be on the side who has one of their favorite champs deleted. That was the point I was trying to make.

While I think the writing team has mostly been on a roll lately with the Bilge stuff, my only major complaint was the Gangplank lines.  I mentioned over on Factions that most of his new lines (especially post-"death") fall into the category of "I'LL [do bad thing] TO YOUR [body part]!"  And, yeah, that was always his persona in the Lore, but pretty much all exposure to Gangplank came from gameplay.  As far as I can remember, Gangplank's only appearance in the lore aside from his own biography (Unless you want to count MF's mother's murder retroactively) before Burning Tides was in the JoJ article about a drinking contest with MF.  So I was, despite being a big lore fan, always associating Gangplank with "Yo ho ho...and a bottle of.....RUM!"  And while his new VA is certainly a better fit for his Lore character, I just had more fun listening to the old one.

And yeah, League is an inherently silly environment.  It has to be remembered that this is a universe where a hamster man flies a helicopter and a chaingun/spatula wielding manatee existed before being murdered by a werewolf.  That doesn't stop some dark stuff from being possible and good variety, but the balance is a very important thing to watch.

I think the champions most at risk of getting this treatment are these:
{{champion:8}} You already brought him up.  Honestly, Riot could just copy/paste Blood Lord's VA and do it, not that I'd want them to, because League has a ton of sinister supernatural villains, and only one pun loving hemomancer.
{{champion:36}} Again, you mentioned him.  Mundo is a tricky character.  Mundo is a serial killer.  He killed people, he killed pets, by all logic we should HATE Mundo.  But everyone loves Mundo.  He's goofy, he's silly, and that works.  I think the darker parts of him are already well presented just by the names of his moves (Infected Cleaver?  Sadism?).
{{champion:45}} This is a tricky one too.  Veigar's backstory is pretty traumatic.  But a big part of Veigar's personality is that yes, he is laughable.  I think exploring some of the more sympathetic parts of him could work in a backstory piece like MF/GP/Graves/TF's new ones, or perhaps during a Bandle City event, but a lot of those funny lines are just the core of his character now.  He has a little charm that way.  That was a short joke.
